database_info.subject: Science
database_info.description: Structured curriculum data sorted by class and topic, including short notes, questions, and special concepts.

antigravity.definition: A hypothetical concept of creating a place or object that is free from the force of gravity.
antigravity.scientific_reality: In current physics, gravity is a fundamental force of attraction between masses. There is no known technology to 'shield' or 'block' gravity.

related_phenomena.name: Magnetic Levitation (Maglev)
related_phenomena.description: Using powerful magnets to float objects (like trains) above a track. This acts against gravity but does not remove it.

related_phenomena.name: Microgravity (Zero-G)
related_phenomena.description: Experienced by astronauts in orbit. They are not free from gravity; they are in a constant state of free-fall, creating the sensation of weightlessness.
